sentences.english: Jewish holy sites were not maintained, and their cemeteries had been desecrated .
sentences.chinese: 因此犹太人的圣地不再得到维护，墓园被亵渎。

sentences.english: "Menelaus" is that a good Jewish name?
Jewish people celebrate the holiday of Hanukkah.
All the Israelites railed against Moses and Aaron.
sentences.chinese: 所有犹太人开始指责摩西和亚伦。

sentences.english: Even so, Kaifeng Jews say they weren't singled out for discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，开封犹太人说他们并没有遭到歧视对待。

sentences.english: The propitiatory system of the Jews is well known.
sentences.chinese: 犹太人的安抚体系是众所周知的。

sentences.english: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 因有好些犹太人，为拉撒路的缘故，回去信了耶稣。

sentences.english: And some Jews would go along with this and some Jews would resist it.
sentences.chinese: 有些犹太人接受了，有些却抵制。

sentences.english: Protestants and Jews have different ones.
sentences.chinese: 新教徒和犹太人则遵循另一部。

sentences.english: They cast a spell on you, you know, the Jews.
sentences.chinese: 他们在你身上投射了一道咒符，你知道吗，犹太人。

sentences.english: Even strangers who were not Jews, could run to them for safety.
sentences.chinese: 连非犹太人的寄居者，也可以跑到逃城寻求庇护。

sentences.english: Over the last several chapters of John we've seen many examples of Jesus being rejected by the Jews.
sentences.chinese: 上几章中频繁出现犹太人拒绝耶稣的话语。

sentences.english: I show that he had many Jewish acquaintances in Vienna, despite his writing in Mein Kampf that he was sickened by the sight of the Jews he saw there.
sentences.chinese: 我可以告诉你，他在维也纳也有许多相识的犹太人。

sentences.english: Of course, in the Jewish tradition, borscht is never made with pork.
sentences.chinese: 当然，在犹太人的传统中，罗宋汤是从来不放猪肉的。

sentences.english: And began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!
sentences.chinese: 就厌贺他说，恭喜犹太人的王阿。

pinyin: You2 tai4 fu4 guo2 zhu3 yi4
